recipe.ingredients: - lentils: 1 cup - water: 4 cups - diced tomatoes (no salt added): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - carrots (diced): 2 medium - celery (chopped): 3 stalks - onion (chopped): 1 large - garlic (minced): 3 cloves - smoked paprika: 1 teaspoon - dried thyme: 1/2 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon - bay leaf: 1 - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - spinach (optional, chopped): 2 cups
recipe.directions: 1. Sauté Vegetables: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions, carrots, and celery, and sauté until they are softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another minute. 2. Add Lentils and Simmer: Stir in the lentils, diced tomatoes, smoked paprika, thyme, black pepper, and bay leaf. Add 4 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 25 to 30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender. 3. Finish with Spinach: If using spinach, stir it into the stew until wilted, just before serving. 4. Adjust Seasonings and Serve: Remove the bay leaf. Taste and adjust the seasonings, if necessary. Serve hot.
